definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: I want to do it in my best years.
sentences.chinese: 我希望在我年富力強時就能做到。

sentences.english: To be sure it's a long walk to the shops, but you're young and strong.
sentences.chinese: 去那些商店是要走很遠的路，可你年富力強。

sentences.english: Study and work hard before you become old.
sentences.chinese: 趁着年富力強的時候，要努力學習和工作。

sentences.english: He is a man in the flower of his life, about thirty.
sentences.chinese: 他是個年富力強的人，大約三十歲。

sentences.english: We have a number of prime of life.
sentences.chinese: 我們擁有一批年富力強。

sentences.english: They are young and energetic scientists.
sentences.chinese: 他們是年富力強的科學家。

sentences.english: The company has a number of prime of life, experienced team.
sentences.chinese: 目前公司有一批年富力強，經驗豐富的隊伍。

sentences.english: He is man is the flower of his life, about thirty.
sentences.chinese: 他是個年富力強的人，大約三十歲。

sentences.english: The current party leadership the prime of life, forging ahead in unity and full of fighting.
sentences.chinese: 本屆黨政領導班子年富力強，團結奮進，富有戰鬥力。

sentences.english: Try to learn more knowledges no matter they are useful or not when you are still young.
sentences.chinese: 趁現在年富力強的時候，努力做一種學問。

sentences.english: He is in the green and he can do the work well.
sentences.chinese: 他年富力強，可以把工作做好。
